title: Define monetary values with domains
sql:
create domain currency as (
  amount as number(20, 2), currency_code as char(3 char)
)
constraint supported_currencies_c check ( currency_code in ( 'USD', 'GBP', 'EUR' ) )
display case currency_code
  when 'USD' then '$' when 'GBP' then '£' when 'EUR' then '€'
end || to_char(amount, '999,999.00')
order currency_code || to_char(amount, '999,999.00');

alter table order_items modify ( amount, currency_code ) add domain currency;     

select                                              ORDER_ID PRODUCT_ID AMT
  order_id, product_id,                           ---------- ---------- ------------
  domain_display ( amount, currency_code ) amt             3          3 €   4,321.00
from   order_items                                         4          4 £       3.14
order  by domain_order ( amount, currency_code );          2          2 $       9.99
                                                           1          1 $   1,234.56

explanations.text: Swap the currency codes for symbols
Associate the domain with these columns
Format the values according to the DISPLAY expression in the domain
Sort the rows according to the ORDER expression in the domain
